errors.error_description: Installation order is incorrect - installing from requirements.txt before creating and activating virtual environment
correction_candidates: Create virtual environment first: python -m venv myenv && source myenv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
Use conda environment instead: conda create -n myenv python=3.9 && conda activate myenv && pip install -r requirements.txt
Install globally first: pip install --upgrade pip && pip install -r requirements.txt && python -m venv myenv
Use pipenv workflow: pipenv install --dev && pipenv shell
errors.golden_answer: Create virtual environment first: python -m venv myenv && source myenv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt

errors.error_description: References requirements.txt file that doesn't exist in the twine project
correction_candidates: Install twine directly: pip install twine
Use setup.py for development: pip install -e .
Clone and install: git clone repo && pip install -r dev-requirements.txt
errors.golden_answer: Install twine directly: pip install twine
